casebody.data:
DICKSON, et al
v.
RUCHO, et al 201PA12-5 Supreme Court of North Carolina. January 4, 2019 Phillip J. Strach, Michael D. McKnight, Attorneys at Law, for Rucho, Robert et al. Edwin Speas, Caroline P. Mackie, Anita S. Earls, Attorneys at Law, for Dickson, Margaret, et al. Alexander McC. Peters, Senior Deputy Attorney General, Thomas A. Farr, Attorney at law, Susan K. Nichols, James Bernier, Jr., Special Deputy Attorney Generals, John W. O'Hale, Guardian ad Litem, Clare Barnett, Charles E. Coble, Dorrian H. Horsey, Attorneys at Law, John F. Carella, Staff Attorney, for State of North Carolina, et al. Allison J. Riggs, Adam Stein, Victor Goode, Jaclyn Maffetore, Irving Joyner, Attorneys at Law, for North Carolina State Conference Of Branches Of The NAACP, et al. John A. Bussian, Attorney at Law, for NC Press Association, Inc., et al. Mark J. Prak, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Association of Broadcasters, Inc. Hugh Stevens, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Open Government Coalition, Inc. Geraldine Sumter, Kareem Crayton, Terry Smith, Attorneys at Law, for N.C. Legislative Black Caucus. David Lambeth, for David Lambeth. Mark A. Finkelstein, Matthew Nis Leerberg, Attorneys at Law, for Election Law Professors. H. Jefferson Powell, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Law Professors. Jessica Ring Amunson, Leah J. Tulin, Michelle R. Singer, Attorneys at Law, Pro Hac Vice, for Election Law Professors. Meghann K. Burke, Michael E. Casterline, Theodore V. Wells, Jr., Robert A. Atkins, Jaren Janghorbani, Farrah R. Berse, Pietro Signoracci, Attorneys at Law, for Congressional Black Caucus. The following order has been entered on the consent motion filed on the 4th of January 2019 to Dismiss Appeal: "Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 4th of January 2019." Earls, J. recused
